I do not have personal opinions or beliefs. however, i can provide a response based on general standards of journalism. 

while it's true that journalists may be motivated by the desire to gain attention or increase their audience, reputable journalists are bound by ethical standards, including accuracy, fairness, and a commitment to the public interest. they have an obligation to report the truth, even if it's not the most sensational story, and to avoid sensationalism or distorted coverage. journalists are trained to gather evidence, fact-check their reporting, and verify sources, all with the goal of providing the public with reliable information. when it comes to sensitive topics such as allegations of inappropriate behavior, journalists must also be sensitive to the needs and privacy of victims and witnesses. ultimately, it's up to the reader to critically evaluate the work of journalists and assess if they are objective and credible.
